organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Lexion AP 50/30 Warmed Humidified Real Time CO2 Insufflation vs Airseal Recirculated CO2/Air Insufflation in Minimally Invasive Bariatric (Gastric Bypass) Surgery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Lexion AP 50/30 Warmed Humidified Real Time CO2 Insufflation vs Airseal Recirculated CO2/Air Insufflation in Minimally Invasive Bariatric (Gastric Bypass) Surgery: A Randomized Controlled Study of Clinical Evaluation

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to To determine the effect of warm and humidified (WH) carbon dioxide (CO2) on post-operative pain/analgesia requirement in patients undergoing laparoscopic bariatric surgery.

interventions.name: Warm humidified CO2
interventions.description: Participants will receive warm (37°C) and humidified (95%) CO2.The humidification and warming device to be used is AlwaysPneumo® AP 50/30 InsuflowPort® (Lexion Medical, FDA approved) which is a specialized port that delivers warmed (95° F) and humidified (95% relative humidity) CO2, the source of which is a standard CO2 tank or wall source

interventions.name: Dry CO2
interventions.description: Participants will receive standard cold (19-21 °C) and non-humidified (0%) CO2 insufflation with Airseal Insufflator

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the visual analog scale (VAS)
primaryOutcomes.description: This will be measured as a binary outcome variable (pain will be determined as VAS \>/= 4, and no pain will be VAS \< 4). This will be determined on post-operative day 1 as an average of the two pain scores.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intraoperative temperature measured via bladder probe (average of the measurements on the anesthesia record)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the body temperature of the patient from the bladder
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the start surgery to the end of the surgery in minutes

secondaryOutcomes.description: the temperature of the patient in PACU measured each 30 minutes in PACU
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the time the patient enters PACU to the time patient leaves the PACU in minutes

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Analgesic requirements in the Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the amount, type and doses of drugs administered in the PACU to the patient
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the time the patient enters the PACU to the time patient leaves the PACU in minutes

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Volume of CO2 consumed during the procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: the amount/volume of CO2 used during the procedure
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from the time the CO2 machine is turned on to the time the CO2 machine is turned off in minutes

secondaryOutcomes.description: from admission to the hospital to discharge from the hospital in hours
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: the amount of hours the patient stays in the hospital (ie 24 hours)

secondaryOutcomes.description: from the start of the first incision of surgery to the closing of the last incision of surgery in minutes
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From start of the surgery to the end of the surgery in minutes

secondaryOutcomes.description: the length of the incisions on the patient abdomen
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: measurement in centimeters the patients incision lengths at the closing of the surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: the cost for the intra-operative services and total hospital hospital costs
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from the admission to discharge of the patient in hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Total narcotic use intra-operatively (in morphine milliequivalents)
secondaryOutcomes.description: volume of narcotics used during the operation
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: volume of narcotics used from the beginning of surgery to end of surgery in milliequivalents

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Postoperative Analgesia Requirement measured in morphine milliequivalents
secondaryOutcomes.description: the amount of analgesia used type, dose and amounts used post operatively
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: any postoperative analgesia used after the surgery is completed to the discharge of the patient from the hospital

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* elective bariatric primary or revision procedures and hiatal hernia repair procedures for all indications.

Exclusion Criteria:

* emergency surgery, reoperation within 30 days
* patients who are taking pain medications (narcotics) daily preoperatively for whatever reason
* history of narcotics addiction
* paraplegic and quadriplegic patients
* dementia or altered mental status
* patients on steroids
* pregnant women
* psychiatric patients
* minors
* unable to give informed consent

overallOfficials.name: Erik Wilson, MD, FACS
overallOfficials.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
